sourcesContent:
const Resources = () => { return (
RCF-D Spotlight Sessions

We’ve been busy creating some amazing video content to keep you inspired while our live events are on hold.  Our Ideas & Insights video series feature our wonderful specialist coaches sharing ideas, insights and top tips on a range of topics from managing cashflow, building customer loyalty and staying creative during these difficult times.

We’ve also been working on a series of micro-commissions, 5-15 min video pieces featuring the brilliant artists and creatives on the programme.

RCF-D Spotlight: Clare Taylor, Artist Educator – Play with Clay
Clare introduces the idea of play for adults and the benefits of play on our wellbeing, including releasing those much sought after endorphins. With Play with Clay, Clare shows us how to create a clay portrait - a fun activity that you can challenge your colleagues, family and friends to do with you. Clare Taylor runs Bus and Bird Arts, a small community arts organisation working with a range of sectors form education to healthcare.
RCF-D Spotlight: Craig Humpston, Illustrator – Puny Future
This film shows the creation of a page from a work in progress 'Puny Future'. A short story about a post-Earth civilisation where creatures have been bred to act as biological computers. Inevitable calamity ensues! Graphic artist and illustrator Craig Humpston draws influence from cartoon, comics and 80's skate art in his outlandish miasmic emissions. Meandering between creating stories in comics, character design and stand-alone pieces, his work uses digital tools to help develop hand drawn or painted outcomes.
RCF-D Spotlight: Laura Mathews, Maker & Sculptor – The Benefits of Instagram & Patreon
Laura shares her top tips and lessons learned on building a loyal Instagram following and how Patreon has benefitted her business. Invaluable insights for anyone wishing to build their online community and create a new income stream with Patreon. Laura produces handcrafted articulated animals and puppets carved from sustainably sourced wood.
RCF-D Spotlight: Emily Ryalls, Photographer
Emily Ryalls, Photographer – Emily provides a window into her photography practice, how she’s keeping creative during a lockdown and the making of a current project, the Fun and Games Zine. Emily is concerned with using the camera as a means of representation and visual storytelling. Personal experiences of gender disparity in the healthcare system fuel a lot of Emily's personal work and her more recent work highlights an intersection between performance and photography.
Spotlight: Matt McGuinness, Musician - The One to Save You Now
In this film, musician Matt McGuinness talks about a song that's really important to him - The One to Save You Now by Micah. P. Hinson. Matt shares his personal interpretation of the song, reflecting on our relationship with music, and the powerful impact that lyrics and melody can have on our mental health.
Spotlight: Lensfayre
Founders of Lensfayre, Alecia Barnes and Dan Giannopoulos shine a spotlight on their journey of setting up creative business Lensfayre, an analogue camera store and photography community.  As well as sharing top tips on building online sales, Alecia and Dan share why accessibility, inclusivity and diverse representation are at the core of what they do.
RCF-D Insights and Ideas
RCF D Ideas & Insights - Cashflow & Funding
This first episode focuses on Cashflow and Funding and features Tina Smith, Debbie Bryan and Bev Shephard, hosted by our Creative Business Coach Ellen O’Hara.
RCF-D Ideas & Insights: Customer Loyalty
Carol Adlam and Bev Shephard share their ideas, insights and top tips on maintaining relationships, building loyalty and connection during lockdown and the importance of adapting to the changing needs of our customers and audiences.
RCF-D Ideas & Insights: Creativity & Wellbeing
Camilla Brown, Carol Adlam and Debbie Bryan share their ideas, insights and top tips on staying creative, how they've adapted their creative practice, and the importance of self care and wellbeing as a creative business owner.
RCF-D Ideas & Insights: The Journey and Lessons Learnt Along The Way, Saziso Phiri
In this insightful film, cultural producer and curator Saziso Phiri shares her journey of establishing The Anti Gallery. Saziso shares insights on networking on getting her foot in the door, making the most of resources, learning from her mistakes and overcoming imposter syndrome.  This is part 1 of a 2 part video series - in part 2, Saziso will respond to your questions, sharing more amazing insights and ideas from her perspective as a curator and producer - email us your questions at rcf@nae.org.uk
RCF-D Ideas & Insights: The Personal Is Political - Camilla Brown
There are a startling number of women artists making themselves the subject of their own work today.   In this film, academic, writer and curator Camilla Brown considers the political implications of this use of the self, referencing the work of three women artists Trish Morrissey, Sian Bonnell, and E. J. Major.
) } export default Resources;
